author: nftdao
title: One-Click ₳ Pay
description: ₳ Pay market penetration requires simple to use and integrate design patterns aimed at their target small to medium ecommerce platforms.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge by targeting the exact requirements of "integrating adapay solution via plugins to ecommerce websites".

As a developer myself i understand that providing software solutions is just not enough, and one of the requirements is scalability of the plugins. The proposal addresses this aspect quite well in their detailed plan as well as in problem and solution statement. 

Designing a simple easy to integrated UI/UX is as important as integrating well designed solution from the beginning. This is in align with Cardano's strategy which has allowed Cardano to stay in top 5 or 6 crypto currencies the entire time since its inception.

The proposal solution clearly   also mentions which ecommerce platforms they are targetting as part of this solution. This therefore, for me is very well in align with the challenge settings. Hence full stars from my side.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team of this proposal has given good description of the team members experience, however, a public link to their profile would have been better. 

This, however is compensated by the public github link to their repos which also has link to their twitter profile.

As can be seen that they already have integration with  A pay merchant account for their ticket sale app, so clearly they have good experience working with integration of ada pay solution.


The plan, in terms of timeline, is well outlined, which gives good overview on when team expects coding/testing phase to be finished.

Proposal has also identified the integration platforms and how this integration will look like. However, i would be a little bit more interested in getting into technical details (oops i am a developer myself) of why 3 engineers would need 200 hours each for doing the backend work of integrating with ada Pay solution. To me JS engineer budget looks more than what it should be, but this question can be kept for review times. Overall, This proposal asks for more than 40% of the total budget allocation, and i think the budget is a little bit over the roof.

Also i noticed that programming language is written as Java (node.js). I think what proposer meant was to have either Java or Node.js or both, but from the text it looks like they are using Java which is also called Node.js ? 

All in all a well written proposal but imo still there are some room for improvements. Hence, 4 stars from my side.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal as team of this proposal has good experience with blockchain tech (as visible by the GitHub activities). 

Additionally, we can see that community will have the opportunity to clearly see in how many months which feature sets are to be expected. This provides a good feedback loop between the team and community.

Therefore, i think it should be fairly easy for community to audit the progress and success of this proposal, hence I strongly agree.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a bold proposal that aims to infiltrate in the top 5 e-commerce websites. However, I feel that it lacked a lot of explanations on how they intend to do that. Their objectives are aligned with the goals of the challenge. For instance, they show a lot of concern regarding the UI/UX of the product, which is quite positive. But more comments could have been given regarding the ideas they aim to put in practice. How exactly they intend to make the plug-ins clean and easy-to-use was not thoroughly debated. Other topic that could have been more explored is the quality of the solution. What are their intentions in terms of what they consider as a robust solution? This was not discussed. In short, this could have been a great proposal have the team articulated better and, in more details, how they expect to add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: It is not clear that this team will have the capacity to successfully implement the idea proposed. Some evidence was given about the relevant skills of the team, but it was not mentioned who exactly is part of the team and their past experiences were cited in a vague manner. The budget is broken down into identifiable items and its final sum is within reasonable limits, but each item in the budget could have had its value better justified. Also, it could have been better integrated with the roadmap, it is not clear that the hours of work estimated in the budget match the timetable targeted. Finally, there is no considerations regarding the case of needing additional funding, which is always a project risk.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of this proposal is weak. It does not seem it will be easy to evaluate if the project is advancing as expected. The roadmap is too simple and too broad. The deadlines presented are reasonable but there are no KPIs specified to assess the progress of the team. Metrics on the success of transactions, number of users expected to be reached and future scalability without loss of quality of the product could and should have been discussed.
f6_assessments.reply: The assessor opinion is they wanted to read more details of exactly how the sausage is made. We feel we added enough detail to be able to assess the proposal, everyone can always add more details and create reams of details, but it is not practical or needed for the majority to assess the viability of a proposal.
